page.title: 04Trade in Willingham
page.content: There are some{28 shops}in the village covering most essential domestic requirements. The 'Co-op' is the only national chain store in the village. It has a wines and spirits licence and sells a wide range of goods and groceries. The other shops are all {privately owned,}many being long established family businesses such as the Berrycroft and Milberry Stores. Newer enterprises include an art gallery and a shoe shop. Although the village can supply most local needs yet many people prefer to go to Bar Hill or Cambridge where there are large supermarkets. Vegetables and fruit in season can be bought quite cheaply at the side of the road and many local growers{sell {direct}to the public. The village has 2 banks, 3 garages and a post office.
